item.title: Code monkey
item.author: benoit@myard.xyz (Benoit Myard)
item.description: Code monkey is a derogatory term for programmers hired to write simple and repetitive code. It somewhat echoes the Infinite monkeys theorem albeit applied to narrower subject – which has only become a reality thanks to code monkeys. When asked, Karl Marx GPT, who is quite literal, had much to say: The term “code monkey” is a colloquial expression in the tech world! It refers to a programmer or software developer whose job primarily involves writing and debugging code, often with minimal involvement in higher-level design, strategic decision-making, or creative problem-solving.
